output.conclusion: By the end of this course, you will have a solid foundation in Web3 development, equipped with the knowledge and skills to build decentralized applications and contribute to the evolving Web3 ecosystem.
output.introduction: This course is designed for developers with existing programming experience who want to dive into the world of Web3. We'll cover the core concepts, tools, and technologies needed to build decentralized applications (dApps) on blockchain platforms.

chapters.description: A brief overview of blockchain concepts, including blocks, transactions, hashing, and consensus mechanisms. We'll explore different types of blockchains and their characteristics.
Understanding the principles of Web3, decentralization, and the shift from centralized web applications. We'll discuss the benefits and challenges of Web3 development.
Configuring your development environment with necessary tools like Node.js, npm, and a code editor. We'll also introduce popular Web3 development frameworks.
An overview of the Ethereum blockchain, its architecture, and its role in the Web3 ecosystem. We'll discuss the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) and its importance.
Understanding smart contracts, their purpose, and how they function on the Ethereum blockchain. We'll cover the basics of smart contract deployment and execution.
Introduction to Solidity, the primary programming language for writing smart contracts on Ethereum. We'll cover basic syntax, data types, and control structures.
Hands-on practice writing basic smart contracts, such as token contracts and simple voting systems. We'll focus on implementing core functionalities.
Understanding common security vulnerabilities in smart contracts and implementing best practices to mitigate risks. We'll discuss techniques for secure coding.
Learn how to test and debug smart contracts effectively using tools like Truffle and Ganache. We'll cover unit testing and integration testing strategies.
An overview of Web3.js, a JavaScript library for interacting with the Ethereum blockchain. We'll learn how to connect to Ethereum nodes and interact with smart contracts.
Setting up and connecting to Metamask, a popular browser extension for managing Ethereum accounts. We'll learn how to request user accounts and sign transactions.

chapters.chapterTitle: Interacting with Smart Contracts from Web3.js
chapters.description: Learn how to call smart contract functions, send transactions, and retrieve data from smart contracts using Web3.js. We'll build a simple dApp interface.
Understanding the InterPlanetary File System (IPFS) and its role in decentralized storage. We'll discuss how IPFS works and its benefits for Web3 applications.
Learn how to store data on IPFS using command-line tools and libraries. We'll cover pinning and content addressing concepts.
Integrating IPFS with smart contracts to store and retrieve data. We'll build a dApp that uses IPFS for storing user-generated content.
Exploring different Layer-2 scaling solutions for Ethereum, such as Optimistic Rollups, ZK-Rollups, and state channels. We'll discuss their trade-offs and use cases.
Introduction to Polygon (formerly Matic Network), a popular Layer-2 scaling solution for Ethereum. We'll learn how to deploy smart contracts on Polygon.
Deploying smart contracts to the Polygon network and interacting with them using Web3.js. We'll cover the steps involved in bridging assets between Ethereum and Polygon.
